Dear Mr. Derscheid:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
On 7/22/22, youth got into a van when they were not supposed to. Staff member
attempted to physically pull youth from the van and both staff members dragged
youth out of the van by youth's feet. Youth's buttocks hit the concrete. Youth
attempted to assault staff and was restrained. Staff pulled youth's shirt over their
face and pressed their forearm against youth's face.
2

INVESTIGATION:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on July 26, 2022, and reported
they had no further information.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 27, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Administrator stated Staff 3 was no longer
employed at the facility as of July 26, 2022. Administrator reported Staff 3 had not
worked since the incident on July 22, 2022. Administrator denied Youth A having
any injuries. Administrator reported Staff 3 removed Youth A from the van in an
unsafe manner and did not use an approved method of behavior management.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 27, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A stated he refused to get out of the van
and Staff 3 grabbed Youth A’s ankles and pulled him out of the van. Youth A
described falling out of the van, landing on his butt, standing up and punching Staff 3
in the face. Youth A stated he was placed in a restraint by Staff 2. Youth A reported
during the restraint Staff 3 pulled Youth A’s shirt over his face and placed his
forearm over his mouth, squeezing his check and jaw. Youth A stated he was in a
seated position being restrained by Staff 2, who was holding his arms, when Staff 3
did this. Youth A described Staff 3 pushing his head back into Staff 2 “really hard.”
Youth A said, Staff 2 told Staff 3 to stop pushing on his face. Youth A stated Staff 3
told Staff 2, no he is going to bite me. Youth A stated he eventually did bite Staff 3.
Youth A reported eventually Staff 3 moved his arm and stopped pushing. Youth A
denied having any injuries.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated he debriefed with Staff 2 and
Youth A and reviewed video of the incident. Staff 1 reported Youth A told him he
was pulled out of the van by Staff 3, Staff 3 covered Youth A’s face with his shirt and
placed his forearm over Youth A’s mouth. Staff 1 stated the video showed Staff 3
physically removing Youth A from the van by his legs and Youth A falling to the
ground. Youth A got up, punched Staff 3 and was placed in a restraint by Staff 2.
Staff 1 reported the video showed Youth A kicking at Staff 3, Staff 3 grabbing Youth
A’s legs, Staff 3 pulled Youth A’s shirt over Youth A’s face and placed his forearm
into Youth A’s head and pushed Youth A’s head into Staff 2. Staff 1 stated staff are
not trained to pull youth by their legs from the van, grab the legs of a youth when
being kicked, or to pull a youth’s shirt over the youth’s head and place a forearm on
a youth’s head. Staff 1 reported if a youth is spitting the facility has spit masks or a
cushion the staff can hold to prevent being spit on. Staff 1 stated Staff 3 reported he
was bit by Youth A, but Staff 1 denied seeing any marks. Staff 1 denied Youth A
being injured or stating he was hurt. Staff 1 reported the behavior management
used by Staff 3 is not what is trained.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described Youth A refusing to get out of
3

the van after five minutes of redirection so Staff 3 pulled Youth A out of the van by
his ankles. Staff 2 stated he stepped in and Youth A punched Staff 3 in the face.
Staff 2 reported he placed Youth A into an upper torso restraint and Youth A started
kicking at Staff 3. Staff 2 described Staff 3 grabbing Youth A’s feet. Staff 2 reported
he transitioned to a seated restraint where he was kneeling behind Youth A still
holding his arms. Staff 2 reported Youth A was angry and spitting. Staff 2 described
Staff 3 pulling Youth A’s shirt up over Youth A’s nose and mouth to block the spit
and then placing his arm up on Youth A’s face. Staff 2 denied Youth A being
pushed into him by Staff 3. Staff 2 stated he told Staff 3 to move his arm down from
Youth A’s face. Staff 2 reported staff are not trained to grab youths’ feet or place a
shirt or arm over a youth’s face. Staff 2 reported the facility has spit masks and a
pad blocker for spitting. Staff 2 denied Youth A having any injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated he asked Youth A to leave the
van, he refused, kicked Staff 3 in the face so Staff 3 grabbed Youth A’s feet and
pulled him out of the van. Staff 3 stated he was not sure if Youth A fell out of the van
but when Youth A was out of the van, he punched Staff 3 in the face. Staff 3 stated
Staff 2 placed Youth A in an upper torso restraint, they transitioned to the ground
and Staff 3 tried to bridge Youth A’s legs. Staff 3 reported Youth A was spitting so
he pulled Youth A’s shirt over his head, eventually moving the shirt to cover Youth
A’s nose and mouth. Staff 3 stated he did have his forearm up by Youth A’s face
because Youth A was trying to bite him. Staff 3 admitted staff are not trained to pull
youth out of a van. Staff 3 stated, “it was not a good choice in hindsight.” Staff 3
stated he could not recall much more of the incident because it happened so fast.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 29, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described Youth A refusing to get out
of the van and Staff 3 pulling Youth A by his legs out of the van. Youth B stated
Youth A landed on his feet when he got out of the van and was placed in a restraint.
Youth B denied having any concerns or seeing any bruises on Youth A.
DHHS Worker has no findings in the investigation.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage for the incident on 07/22/2022 was saved to a zip drive and reviewed
with DHHS Worker on 08/11/2022. Video was consistent with the incident report
and Youth A’s interview.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Staff 3’s personnel file: One corrective action discipline note dated 02/28/22
not related to physical management of youth.
• Incident Report 139220194 which was consistent with staff and youth
interviews.
• Pineview Homes Notice of Termination of Employment for Staff 3 dated
07/26/22. Staff 3 was placed on suspension on 07/22/22 following review of
4

the incident and a meeting was held on 07/26/22 once Administrator returned
to the facility to end Staff 3’s employment.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Rule 158. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the
following forms of intervention: (a) Any type of physical
punishment including, but not limited to: (ii) Hitting or
striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on
any part of their body.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as during interviews with
staff and youth it was determined Staff 3 pulled Youth A out of
the van by Youth A’s ankles. Interviews with staff and youth
also described Staff 3 pulling Youth A’s shirt over his nose and
mouth and placing his forearm against Youth A’s face to prevent
him from spitting.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan no change be
made to the license status of this child caring institution.
